title: CBS Suspends TV Station Executives Amid Allegations of Hostile Workplace
sub_head: Peter Dunn and David Friend, who oversee a group of 28 local stations, were put on administrative leave as a probe is conducted
body:
CBS put two senior executives on administrative leave and launched an investigation into their conduct, amid allegations in a Los Angeles Times report that the two fostered a hostile work environment, the company said.
The executives, TV Stations Group President Peter Dunn and David Friend, who is in charge of local news for the stations, oversee CBS’s 28 local stations in major markets across the country, including New York, Los Angeles and Chicago.
According to the article in the Los Angeles Times, Messrs. Dunn and Friend resisted efforts to hire and retain Black journalists, bullied female executives and mocked some on-air talent.
Among the incidents cited in the report was Mr. Dunn allegedly referring to Ukee Washington, a Black anchor at CBS-owned KYW-TV Philadelphia, as a “jive guy.” Mr. Friend said of Mr. Washington that all he does is dance, according to the article.
In a statement, CBS said it would launch a third-party probe into issues that were raised in the report.
